body.p: By default, DITA <note> elements are formatted using the note and note_tbl (for <note> elements within a table) ParaDef format definitions, configured using MiramoDesigner.
To illustrate how MiramoDesigner can be used to control note formatting consider the following three <note> examples:
The DITA source for the three notes shown above is shown here:
body.codeblock: <note>First note</note> <note type="warning">Second warning note</note> <note type="other" othertype="Other type of note">Third othertype note</note>
body.p: When MiramoPDF renders a <note> element it constructs a note paragraph from the following components, illustrated here:

dlentry.dd: The DITA-OT automatically populates the note ParaDef label with the appropriate icon, where the name of the note icon graphic is derived from the note @type attribute, eg warning.svg The icon graphic file is located in the folder mmpdf:images.dir folder, with the file suffix given by the mmpdf:images.suffix build parameter. By default, the noteimage FontDef is applied to the image, which allows the baseline of the icon to be adjusted via the noteimage FontDef properties.

The language specific variable corresponding to the given note type is automatically inserted at the beginning of the note paragraph text, followed by the language specific separator lang-separator (for most languages, this defaults to the ':' character). The notetext FontDef is applied to this prefix text, allowing the text to be distinguished from the note element content. See .
The contents of the note element are rendered using the note or note_tbl ParaDef properties.
